children.text: The fixings installed into the sheet flooring have been driven too deep through the sheets.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 1860.2 Particleboard Flooring – Installation in section 10.3 Nails states that

‘Nailing machines shall be adjusted so that the heads of the nails penetrate the surface by not more than 1mm. The use of a flush drive attachment, a chisel drive nail machine or similar is required’ .

These sheets will need to have additional fixings installed to the joists at no greater than 150mm centres on their ends, and 300mm centres on intermediate joists as required by AS 1860. Care must be taken to ensure that these fixings are driven no further than 1mm deep.
